channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My wife and I are in our 50s and have $11 million. We’re not leaving it to our kids. Is that wrong?
item.description: “We have retired from full-time work.”

item.title: Opendoor’s stock is rocketing again. What can make it keep going?
item.description: Opendoor shares are skyrocketing again as noted bull Eric Jackson said that the company needs to dive deeper into AI and rethink its business model.

item.title: The looming crisis of AI speed without guardrails
item.description: The future will arrive with or without our guardrails. We must design AI’s structures now for a future of abundance rather than disruption.

item.title: WiBotic obtains three certifications for wireless robot charging
item.description: WiBotic explains how safety compliance and certifications demonstrate the global deployability of robotics. The post WiBotic obtains three certificati...

item.title: GEPA optimizes LLMs without costly reinforcement learning
item.description: Moving beyond the slow, costly trial-and-error of RL, GEPA teaches AI systems to learn and improve using natural language.

item.title: Why we should thank pigeons for our AI breakthroughs
item.description: In 1943, while the world’s brightest physicists split atoms for the Manhattan Project, the American psychologist B.F. Skinner led his own secret gover...

item.title: My aunt barely spends any money. Will we receive the contents of her safe-deposit box when she dies?
item.description: “I am asking for my mom, who is on a fixed income. It would be a nice boon.”

item.title: Hugging Face: 5 ways enterprises can slash AI costs without sacrificing performance
item.description: Ultimately, model makers and enterprises are focusing on the wrong issue: They should be computing smarter, not harder.

item.title: Palantir’s stock is sliding. Here’s why this short-seller thinks even a $40 price tag is ‘generous.’
item.description: Andrew Left argues that investors have overhyped Palantir stock, and its valuation pales in comparison to a true AI leader like OpenAI.

item.title: TensorZero nabs $7.3M seed to solve the messy world of enterprise LLM development
item.description: TensorZero raises $7.3 million to build an open-source AI infrastructure stack that helps enterprises scale and optimize large language model (LLM) ap...

item.title: My friend’s father gifted her Tesla and Google stock. They could be worth millions. Will they be split 50/50 in her divorce?
item.description: “My friend is working on an exit plan.”

item.title: The Download: pigeons’ role in developing AI, and Native artists’ tech interpretations

item.title: Serve Robotics acquires Vayu Robotics to enhance delivery robots
item.description: The companies will combine Serve’s autonomy stack and real‑world dataset with Vayu’s AI foundation models. The post Serve Robotics acquires Vayu Robot...

item.description: The robotics leader will demonstrate how the powerful combination of robotics and AI can transform food production with speed and precision The post S...

item.title: University of Waterloo researchers develop robots to directly treat kidney stones
item.description: Waterloo researchers have developed a minimally invasive treatment to ease kidney stone pain with magnets and robots. The post University of Waterloo ...

item.title: Teaching the model: Designing LLM feedback loops that get smarter over time
item.description: How to close the loop between user behavior and LLM performance, and why human-in-the-loop systems are still essential in the age of gen AI.

item.title: Elephant Robotics builds myCobot Pro 450 to meet industrial expectations
item.description: The myCobot Pro 450 is also compatible with a wide range of Large Language Models (LLMs), including DeepSeek, ChatGPT. The post Elephant Robotics buil...

item.title: Indigenous knowledge meets artificial intelligence
